data.introduction: In JavaScript we used to declare a variable with var keyword in which we can't create blocked level scope function and constant value. TypeScript has two type of variable declaration they are const and let and which are used to create block level scope and constant value declaration,
const keyword is use to assign a static value to the data types, constant means it's value is always constant and never change through out it's lifecycle.
If you try to re-assign the value to the const variables then it will throw type declaration error, because we can't change the value of a constant once it's been assigned initially.
let keyword is use to assign a non-static value to the data types, we can modify the value of a variable at any time.
data.code_snippet:
let isVisible: boolean = false;
 isVisible = true;
